frameDefinitions: The Cognizers have a similarity (or dissimilarity) in their Opinion.
Two (or more) people (the Parties, also encodable as Party_1 and Party_2) negotiate an agreement.
A Speaker either agrees to or refuses to engage in a Proposed_action, proposed by an Interlocutor. '' 'They agreed to express their outrage with editorials in today's paper.'
Two (or more) people (the Parties, also encodable as Party_1 and Party_2) have an agreement.
This frame is concerned with the likelihood of a Hypothetical_event occurring.
frameExamples: Dr. Gerry and Mr. Pond <t>agree</t> in their impressions.
So far , we have <t>agreed</t>to cede 100km of coastline to Kiribati . DNI
They <t>agreed</t> to express their outrage with editorials in today's paper.
The US and Russia have an <t>agreement</t> to share early warning data on missile launches.
It is <t>likely</t> that he'll arrive late.
listRoleDefinitions: This role marks constituents that express the set of <fen>Cognizers</fen> whose similarity of opinion is at issue.

When there is an asymmetry, <fen>Cognizer_1</fen> is the individual characterized by their similarity in opinion to <fen>Cognizer_2</fen>, whose opinion is assumed to be known.  <fen>Cognizer_1</fen> is often an external argument.

When the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are expressed separately, <fen>Cognizer_2</fen> is the one whose opinion is assumed to be known; it serves as a basis for establishing the opinion of <fen>Cognizer_1</fen>.

This role denotes an implicit question in response to which the <fen>Cognizers</fen> give their <fen>Opinion</fen>s, which are then assessed for their similarity.  The <fen>Question</fen> may concern the identitiy of a particular entity, as in the first example below, or it may be of the yes/no-type, as in the second example below.
A state of affairs believed by the <fen>Cognizers</fen>.
A phenomenon that the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are considering with respect to their <fen>Opinion</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Cognizers</fen> are in agreement or disagreement.
The Place is the general area in which the Cognizers are in agreement or disagreement.

The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e.
agentive) party of the agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is,
<fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and
peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself
generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus <fen>Manner</fen> is construed to be that of <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.

The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or
group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded
within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with).
An expression of the commitment made by the <fen>Parties</fen> .
<fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered.
The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in making an agreement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> where the Agreement occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the Agreement occurs.
The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the person to whom a particular action has been proposed and who responds to the request or offer made.
This is the person who proposed the <fen>Proposed_action</fen>  to the <fen>Speaker</fen> and to whom the <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates  their response.
The <fen>Proposed_action</fen> is an action that the <fen>Speaker</fen> would perform if they were to accept or refuse the request or offer.
The time interval during which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes their verbal response concerning the proposed action.
The location in which the <fen>Speaker</fen>  gives their verbal response to the proposed action.

The individual or individuals that form the more prominent (i.e. agentive) party of the agreement, as compared with <fen>Party_2</fen>. That is, <fen>Party_1</fen> is generally encoded as the External Argument of verbs, and peripheral FEs that do not make reference to the event itself generally make reference to <fen>Party_1</fen>. Thus <fen>Manner</fen> is construed to be that of <fen>Party_1</fen>, not necessarily that of <fen>Party_2</fen> or the group of <fen>Parties</fen> as a whole.
The semantically (and grammatically) less prominent participant (or group of participants) in the agreement. It is generally encoded within a prepositional phrase (e.g. headed by with).
An expression of the commitment of the <fen>Parties</fen> .
<fen>Topic</fen> is a description of the domain covered by the agreement.
The group of individuals portrayed as equally involved in having an agreement.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the agreement was made.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where an agreement was made.
The state of affairs or occurrence whose likelihood is assessed.
When the event occurs.
Where the event takes place.
listRoleExamples: I think we see eye to eye <fex>in our ultimate goal</fex>, which is that we want to see a democratic Serbia.
We agree <fex>that babies should not be dropped from helicopters</fex>.
On Monday, <fex>the airline</fex> reached a deal with the Canadian Auto Workers.
Mozilla Foundation has finally reached an agreement <fex>with America Online</fex>.
The US and Russia have agreed <fex>to share early warning data on missile launches</fex>.
Some types of alloy steel have been covered in the expiring <fex>trade</fex> agreement.
<fex>The US and Russia</fex> have agreed to cooperate in destroying surplus portable anti-aircraft missiles.
The town coucil members finally reached an agreement <fex>at midnight</fex>.
The town coucil members reached an agreement <fex>at the City Hall plenary session</fex>.
<fex>AOL 's</fex> agreement with the ACLU will soon expire , and renogotiation is not a real possibility .
Mozilla Foundation now has a bindingagreement <fex>with America Online</fex>.
The US and Russia have an agreement <fex>to share early warning data on missile launches</fex>.
Some types of alloy steel have been covered in the expiring <fex>trade</fex> agreement.
<fex>The US and Russia</fex> have an agreement to cooperate in destroying surplus portable anti-aircraft missiles.
The missile agreement <fex>of 1952</fex> was still in force, however.
The <fex>Kyoto</fex> treaty has so far been relatively ineffectual.
<fex>Rain</fex> is fairly unlikely today, I think.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>today</fex>.
There is a high chance of rain <fex>in Seattle</fex>.
